result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott R Margelofsky

defendant.name: Margelofsky, Scott R
defendant.address: 2436 N Browns Lake Dr, Burlington, WI 53105

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Tom Hayes.  VRC - present in court.  Defense requests an adjournment; needs discovery.   No objection by the State.  Status set for 12/12/22 @ 2pm.

Defendant, Scott R Margelofsky, appeared with Attorney Tom Hayes.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Herbert H, Joyce H

Clerk JT  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. rb
